result.execSummary:
The defendant Clint C Karklus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assesment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion. 1 day credit.
Agent to also determine Straight time or Huber time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Clint C Karklus in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Court imposed the following sentence:    
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling 
  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 30 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  One day credit.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

State is requesting an increase in bail.  Court does not adjust bail.  Court adjourns the matter for the status of defendant's treatment through WCS.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
